frame.name: Questioning
frame.definition: <def-root>The words in this frame have to do with a Speaker asking an Addressee a question which calls for a reply (as opposed to making a request which calls for an action on the part of the Addressee). </def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition: <def-root>The person asking a question generally occurs as the External Argument of verb and noun targets: <ex><fex name="Speaker">Pat</fex> <t>quizzed</t> me about where I had been.</ex> <ex><fex name="Speaker">Pat's</fex> <t>question</t> surprised me. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition: <def-root>The Addressee is most frequently the NP Object of a target verb. However, with the verb <ment>inquire</ment>, Addressee can only occur as an <ment>of</ment>-PP and with a noun target, Addressee occurs in a PP Complement or as a possessive : <ex>Pat <t>questioned</t> <fex name="Addressee">me</fex> about where I had been.</ex> <ex>"Do you often come here?" Kim <t>inquired</t> <fex name="Addressee">of the person sitting next to her</fex>.</ex> <ex>My <t>question</t> <fex name="Addressee">to you</fex> is straightforward.</ex> <ex><fex name="Addressee">Kim's</fex> <t>interrogation</t> by the police was long.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Message
FE.definition: <def-root>The Message, or content of the question, usually takes the form of a direct quote or an embedded question with a verb target: <ex><fex name="Message">"What are you doing?"</fex> Kim <t>inquired</t>.</ex> <ex>Kim <t>inquired</t> <fex name="Message">what I was doing</fex>.</ex> With noun targets, Message is not common (as Topic occurs more frequently). However, Message does occur in a PP Complement with the noun <ment>question</ment>: <ex>The answer to your <t>question</t> <fex name="Message">of how the company makes money</fex> is simply that it doesn't. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>Topic occurs very frequently in this frame with both noun and verb targets. It generally occurs as a PP Complement: <ex>Pat <t>inquired</t> <fex name="Topic">about train times</fex>.</ex> <ex>Pat's <t>inquiry</t> <fex name="Topic">about train times</fex> fell on deaf ears.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>Medium is the physical entity or channel used by the Speaker to transmit the question: <ex>Kim <t>questioned</t> me <fex name="Medium">over the phone</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Internal_cause
FE.definition: <def-root>The body movement may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an Internal Cause, the Agent's mental or emotional state. Internal Cause is expressed in a PP Complement: <ex>Kim <t>asked</t> me several questiosn <fex name="Internal_cause">in frustration</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the questioning occurs.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: grill.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: subject to intense questioning or interrogation.

lexUnit.name: inquiry.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a question or a series of questions

lexUnit.name: interrogate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: ask questions of (someone) closely, aggressively, or formally.

lexUnit.name: interrogation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of interrogating somebody

lexUnit.name: query.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a question, especially one expressing doubt.

lexUnit.name: query.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: ask a query about something, or put a query or queries to.

lexUnit.name: question.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a sentence worded or expressed so as to elicit information.

lexUnit.name: questioning.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of questioning a person

lexUnit.name: ask.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say something in order to obtain an answer or some information
